column5: I have a 1997 Princecraft Superfisherman LX - 14ft and 2011 Yamaha F20.  Loaded with bow mount, battery, gas, gear, and me (I am a big guy at 260lb), I only get about 30-31 kmph.  Feel it should be more.  Boat is rated for max 20 hp.  Thoughts?
Best way is to know what your RPM are at WOT and if the motor is operating in the optimum range. By the sounds of it though I think you're in the ballpark.
Sound right with what you have as as far as power. Are you sure its rated 20 max?

Ok...good to know.  U.S Coast Guard sticker says max 20.  Engine purrs like a kitten and starts immediately.  I am just used to faster boats I guess.  Need to enjoy the ride more without focussing on just getting there.
Seems a little on the fast side to me with a 20hp.I would consider yourself doing pretty good.
Rated for 20 by the pamphlet,  sounds about the right speed.

When doing a search for your boat, I wasn't able to find that model by Princecraft, they had a Super Pro........Starcraft had the Superfisherman and the 14ft model was rated for 40hp  http://www.starcraftmarine.com/sites/default/files/brochures/1997-Starcraft-Fishing-Catalog.pdf  The Princecraft Fisherman is rated for 20HP though  http://boatspecs.iboats.com/Princecraft__1997/bp/54br1356y
You ...gear..bow mount @ battery's ..fuel...18 mph, with a 20 hp I'd be smiling
I feel your pain, I went from a 60 mph bass boat to a ~40 mph v hull, and I really miss the feeling of having your ears pinned back on the water.
I have a Princecraft 14' Yukon with a 25hp Merc on the back. I get about 40 km/h top speed.  Towing a kid on a tube with two others in the boat it goes down to about 32km/h.
If you were a 150lb guy you might get another 5kph out of the boat! Just kidding
Lol...5kmph is not worth the diet!
You're in the ballpark. Don't bring what you don't need on a given trip to save on weight which will dircetly correlate to better top speed and also fuel economy.

I have a 14' Lund, brand new 20 hp Yammy 4 stroke, with full floor, electric troller, 2 batteries a full tank of gas, myself & my gear.  22 MPH which is about 26 KPH.  I'm happy with that speed.  I had a 30 HP Suzuki 2 stroke - went 30 MPH - scary fast for a 14'.
22 MPH which is about 26 KPH.  I think you better recalculate, hate to see ya burn out on re entry
Seems a little on the fast side to me with a 20hp.I would consider yourself doing pretty good. I was thinking the sameâ€¦.that is damn fast for a 20hp with all your other calculations considered.
Alright!  I am happy then!   Thanks!!!
